Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the issue by stating that the entire nuclear arsenal doesn't work, when the problems are primarily related to command and control issues.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that the entire nuclear arsenal doesn't work.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the age of the equipment automatically means it doesn't work, without considering maintenance and upgrades that may have been performed.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to acknowledge alternative explanations for the issues in the nuclear command structure, such as personnel problems and morale, rather than equipment malfunctions.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the issues in the nuclear command structure do not imply that the entire nuclear arsenal doesn't work.
Falters at times: The claim falters by conflating two separate issues - personnel and equipment - and not providing a clear and accurate picture of the situation.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the provided claim.
